column1: NBA Stats 2021/22: All Player Statistics in one Page

column8: MIN%Minutes PercentagePercentage of team minutes used by a player while he was on the floor
column9: USG%Usage RateUsage rate, a.k.a., usage percentage is an estimate of the percentage of team plays used by a player while he was on the floor
column10: TO%Turnover RateA metric that estimates the number of turnovers a player commits per 100 possessions
column17: eFG%Effective Shooting PercentageWith eFG%, three-point shots made are worth 50% more than two-point shots made. eFG% Formula=(FGM+ (0.5 x 3PM))/FGA
column18: TS%True Shooting PercentageTrue shooting percentage is a measure of shooting efficiency that takes into account field goals, 3-point field goals, and free throws.
column21: TRB%Total Rebound PercentageTotal rebound percentage is estimated percentage of available rebounds grabbed by the player while the player is on the court.
column23: AST%Assist PercentageAssist percentage is an estimated percentage of teammate field goals a player assisted while the player is on the court
column27: VIVersatility IndexVersatility index is a metric that measures a player’s ability to produce in points, assists, and rebounds. The average player will score around a five on the index, while top players score above 10
column28: ORTGOffensive RatingIndividual offensive rating is the number of points produced by a player per 100 total individual possessions.
column29: DRTGDefensive RatingIndividual defensive rating estimates how many points the player allowed per 100 possessions he individually faced while staying on the court.
